<p id = "title"><strong>Snow Depth Imputation</strong></p>

<br><br>

<p id = "desc">Much like the <strong>observed temperatures</strong>, the <strong>snow depths</strong> also presented peculiarites.<br><br></p>

<p id = "desc">One critical part to understanding snow depth is understanding this equation: </p>

<br><br>

<center>

![](../snowpack_elevation/r_scripts_replace_na/pics/snow_ratio.png)

</center>

<br><br>

<p id = "desc"><strong>SWE</strong> means <i>snow water equivalent</i>, or the snowpack water content. It's critical because every SNOTEL station has reported <i>SWE</i>, even if <strong>snow depth</strong> is missing. If we know the <strong>snow ratio</strong>, we can simply get the <strong>snow depth</strong> by multiplying the <strong>SWE</strong> by the <strong>snow ratio</strong>.<br><br>This analysis aims at learning the trends in <strong>snow ratio</strong>, so we can simply estimate <strong>snow depth</strong>.</p>
